page.title: 03GEOLOGY/ECOLOGY:TEST VALLEY
page.content: The rocks underlying the Test valley are recent soft sedimentary rocks.They are formed from clay,sands and gravels and give rise to not very fertile soils,some of which are very dry. There is much natural woodland in the area which lies to the north_east of the New Forest.Today the steeper slopes are still covered in woods because it is difficult to farm these areas. The woodland is mixed:there are many native types of tree such as oak,holly hazel,birch and pine. There is much wildlife in the area and the river Test is famous for its fishing.The river is carefully managed by Broadlands Estate.
